Package com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.builtin.spacing

Class UISpacer

java.lang.Object
com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.UIComponent
com.github.chrisblutz.breadboard.ui.toolkit.builtin.spacing.UISpacer
public class UISpacer extends UIComponent
A UISpacer is an invisible component that exists to take up space in a layout. It has a minimum size in a chosen direction (either horizontally or vertically), and no minimum size in the other direction. Spacers are useful in directional layouts to provide space between two components.

If used in a container that allows components to grow to fill space (e.g., a UIFlexContainer), spacers with a weight greater than 0 will grow automatically to fill their available space. This means they can be used to add variable separation between components (e.g., splitting components between left and right alignment).

  • Constructor Details

    • UISpacer

      public UISpacer(Direction direction)
      Creates a new UISpacer with 0 width in the specified direction. This style of spacer is generally only useful in places where the spacer is expected to grow to fill space (e.g., in a UIFlexContainer). If this style of spacer is placed into a container that does not allow it to fill space, this spacer will be functionally useless.

      The spacer has no minimum dimension in the opposite direction provided, so a horizontal spacer will have no vertical minimum height, and vice versa.

      Parameters:
      direction - the Direction the spacer should take up space in

    • UISpacer

      public UISpacer(Direction direction, int spacerWidth)
      Creates a new UISpacer with the specified width in the specified direction. The width passed to this constructor is a minimum width, so the spacer will grow if placed in a container that allows it to grow to fill space (e.g., a UIFlexContainer). Negative widths are not allowed, and will be treated as a width of 0.

      The spacer has no minimum dimension in the opposite direction provided, so a horizontal spacer will have no vertical minimum height, and vice versa.

      Parameters:
      direction - the Direction the spacer should take up space in
      spacerWidth - the minimum width to assign to the spacer

  • Method Details

    • getDirection

      public Direction getDirection()
      Gets the direction this spacer takes up space in. This is the direction where the minimum width selected either by the constructor or by setSpacerWidth(int) applies. The other direction does not have a minimum width.
      Returns:
      The Direction this spacer takes up space in

    • getSpacerWidth

      public int getSpacerWidth()
      Gets the minimum width assigned to this spacer. In layouts that respect component minimum widths, this spacer will take up at least this much space in the direction selected. If the spacer is used in a layout that allows components to grow past their minimum sizes (e.g., a UIFlexContainer), the spacer will fill the space available. The width of a spacer can never be negative.
      Returns:
      The minimum width assigned to this spacer

    • setSpacerWidth

      public void setSpacerWidth(int spacerWidth)
      Sets the minimum width assigned to this spacer. In layouts that respect component minimum widths, this spacer will take up at least this much space in the direction selected. If the spacer is used in a layout that allows components to grow past their minimum sizes (e.g., a UIFlexContainer), the spacer will fill the space available. The width of a spacer may not be negative, and any negative values passed to this method will be treated as widths of 0.
      Parameters:
      spacerWidth - the minimum width to assign to this spacer

    • render

      public void render(UIGraphics graphics)
      Specified by:
